zh: 有热情没知识就像脱缰的野马。

en: His intelligence and experience enabled him to deal with the trouble.
zh: 他的聪明才智和经验让他能处理这个麻烦。

en: Knowledge in itself is not an end, but a means to an end: to live a full and humane life.
zh: 知识本身不是目的，而是过上充实、有人性生活的一种手段。

en: Knowledge is not an end in itself.
zh: 知识本身并不是目的。

en: The governor appeared on TV in person.
zh: 州长亲自在电视上露面了。

en: The governor decided to provide assistance for the victims.
zh: 州长决定向灾民提供援助。

en: The governor dedicated the memorial to the soldiers who died in the war.
zh: 州长将纪念碑献给战争中牺牲的士兵。

en: The governor cut the tape and opened the new bridge.
zh: 州长剪了彩，新大桥正式开通。

en: The governor was surprised by the commission's response.
zh: 州长对委员会的反应感到挺意外的。

en: The governor compromised on the subject to a certain degree.
zh: 州长在这个问题上做出了一定程度的让步。

en: The governor's speech was aimed at the press.
zh: 州长的讲话是针对媒体的。

en: The governor's speech was published in the magazine.
zh: 州长的讲话在杂志上发表了。

en: The governor is capable of handling his current difficulties.
zh: 州长有能力应付目前的困境。

en: I hear the governor's been getting money under the table from tobacco companies.
zh: 我听说州长一直在收烟草公司的黑钱。

en: I racked my brains to write this.
zh: 为了写这个，我绞尽了脑汁。

en: Wisdom is better than riches.
zh: 智慧胜过财富。

en: Wisdom cannot come without experience.
zh: 没有经验就没有智慧。

en: Wisdom does not consist only in knowing facts.
zh: 智慧不只是知道事实。

en: Perception is based, to a very large extent, on conceptual models - which are always inadequate, often incomplete and sometimes profoundly wrong.
zh: 感知在很大程度上取决于概念模型，而这些模型往往不够完善、经常不完整，甚至是大错特错。

en: I'll call a repairman I know who'll be at your house to fix the washing machine promptly.
zh: 我会给我认识的一个修理工打电话，让他赶紧去你家修洗衣机。

en: Who doesn't know?
zh: 谁不知道啊？

en: Night had completely fallen before we knew.
zh: 不知不觉间，天已经完全黑了。

en: Don't pretend you don't know.
zh: 别装不知道。

en: There are things you better don't know.
zh: 有些事你最好还是别知道。

en: Didn't you know that?
zh: 你原来不知道吗？

en: Didn't you know?
zh: 你不知道吗？

en: I have these little habits that show themselves when I least expect it, so I have to watch myself.
zh: 我总是在不经意间流露出一些小习惯，所以我得时刻克制着点。

en: Look up words you don't know in your dictionary.
zh: 遇到不认识的词就查查字典。

en: If you come across an unfamiliar word, look it up in your dictionary.
zh: 如果你碰到生词，就查查字典。

en: I'm reluctant to let myself be known in strange company.
zh: 我不愿意在陌生人面前表现自己。

en: Tom trained his dog to bark at strangers.
zh: 汤姆训练他的狗冲陌生人叫。

en: Tom conditioned his dog to bark at strangers.
zh: 汤姆训练他的狗一见到陌生人就叫。

en: A stranger seized me by the arm.
zh: 一个陌生人抓住了我的胳膊。

en: A stranger came up and asked me the way to the hospital.
zh: 一个陌生人走过来问我去医院的路。

en: You shouldn't accept candy from strangers.
zh: 你不该拿陌生人的糖。

en: See to it that no strangers come into this room.
zh: 注意别让陌生人进这个房间。

en: You must beware of strange dogs.
zh: 你得提防着点不认识的狗。

en: No, I don't. You had better look it up in a telephone directory.
zh: 我不知道，你最好查查电话簿。

en: Where ignorance is bliss, 'tis folly to be wise.
zh: 无知便是福，聪明反被聪明误。

en: The years go by before I know, so I don't wanna miss this chance.
zh: 不知不觉几年就过去了，我不想错过这次机会。

en: His face fell when he heard the news.
zh: 听到消息，他的脸一下子就垮下来了。

en: Before I knew it, the plane had landed.
zh: 还没等我反应过来，飞机就降落了。

en: They were excited at the news.
zh: 听到那个消息，他们很兴奋。

en: The news was very surprising to her.
zh: 这个消息让她感到很意外。

en: Please let me know.
zh: 请告诉我一声。

en: It is one thing to know and another to teach.
zh: 知道是一回事，教又是另一回事。

en: It is impossible, you know, to make him agree.
zh: 你知道的，要让他同意是不可能的。

en: If only I knew, I would tell you all that I knew.
zh: 如果我知道，我肯定会把我所知道的全告诉你。

en: If he knows the truth, he will tell us.
zh: 如果他知道真相，他会告诉我们的。

en: Had I known it, I would have told you.
zh: 我要是早知道，就告诉你了。

en: If I'd known it, I'd have told you.
zh: 我要是早知道，我就告诉你了。

en: If I had known it, I would have told you.
zh: 如果我早点知道，我肯定就告诉你了。

en: If only I knew!
zh: 要是我知道就好了！

en: Well you can imitate everyone you know.
zh: 嘿，你认识的每个人你都能模仿。

en: To know is one thing, to practice another.
zh: 知道是一回事，实践是另一回事。

en: To know is one thing, and to do is another.
zh: 知道是一回事，做又是另一回事。

en: Knowing is one thing, teaching quite another.
zh: 知道是一回事，教又是另外一回事。

en: To know is one thing, to teach is another.
zh: 知道是一回事，教又是另一回事。

en: To know is one thing, and quite another to do.
zh: 知道是一回事，做起来完全是另一回事。

en: If he had known, he might have come earlier.
zh: 如果他早点知道，可能就来得更早了。

en: Did you ask the price?
zh: 你问过价钱了吗？

en: Can you guess the price?
zh: 你能猜猜这多少钱吗？

en: We fixed the price at $15.
zh: 我们把价格定在了15美元。

en: The price was absurdly high.
zh: 价格高得离谱。

en: Apart from the cost, the dress doesn't suit me.
zh: 除了价格，这件裙子也不太适合我。

en: The price depends on the size.
zh: 价格取决于尺寸。

en: Cost is a definite factor in making our decision.
zh: 价格确实是我们做决定的一个重要因素。

en: The price is none too high.
zh: 价格一点也不贵。

en: The price was only three thousand yen, or about thirty dollars.
zh: 价格只要三千日元，也就三十美元左右。

en: Apart from the cost, the color of the tie doesn't suit me.
zh: 除了价格，这条领带的颜色也不适合我。

en: Apart from the cost, the dress doesn't suit you.
zh: 除了价格，这件裙子也不太适合你。

en: The price is up to you.
zh: 价格你说了算。

en: I will take the one that is more expensive.
zh: 我要买贵点的那个。

en: Expensive things often prove more economical in the long run.
zh: 从长远来看，贵的东西往往更划算。

en: The price did not enter into our consideration.
zh: 我们根本没考虑过价格。

en: The price includes the consumption tax.
zh: 价格里包含消费税。

en: If the price is reasonable, I want to buy the car.
zh: 如果价格合理，我想买这辆车。

en: I was agreeably surprised by the low prices.
zh: 价格居然这么低，真是让我喜出望外。

en: Could you take off the price tag for me?
zh: 能帮我把价签撕了吗？

en: Please let us know your conditions for making the concession.
zh: 请告诉我们，你们需要什么条件才肯让步。

en: Could you give me a discount?
zh: 能给我打个折吗？

en: The price will not come down.
zh: 价格降不下来。

en: Men's things are on sale upstairs.
zh: 楼上的男士用品在打折。

en: The men were at a loss.
zh: 那些男人们都懵了。

en: Schoolboys usually look up to great athletes.
zh: 男学生通常都很崇拜伟大的运动员。

en: Men's clothing is loose fitting.
zh: 男装穿起来比较宽松。

en: Ladies before gentlemen.
zh: 女士优先。

en: Men, too, have discovered that there are various roles they can play.
zh: 男人们也发现，他们可以扮演各种不同的角色。

en: Every man should learn how to cook.
zh: 每个男人都应该学学怎么做饭。

en: Men like to look masculine.
zh: 男人们喜欢让自己看起来很有男人味。

en: Gentlemen remove their hats in the presence of a lady.
zh: 绅士在女士面前会脱帽。

en: Men are said to be quick at figures.
zh: 听说男的算数都挺快的。

en: Jackets are requested for men.
zh: 男士请穿上西装外套。

en: The man is loading the moving truck on his own.
zh: 那个男的正在一个人往搬家车上装货。

en: It is safer to say that some men and some women are good at figures.
zh: 比较保险的说法是，有些男的和有些女的算数都挺厉害。

en: The greatest cause of stress for men is work, while for women, human relationships come at the top of the list.
zh: 男人的主要压力源于工作，而女人最头疼的则是人际关系。

en: Some men are slow at figures.
zh: 有些男的算数也挺慢的。

en: The men are wearing short sleeves.
zh: 那些男的都穿着短袖。

en: The men are smiling on cue.
zh: 那些男的都在按要求微笑。

en: The men have mustaches.
zh: 那些男的都留着胡子。

en: The men are having a barbecue.
zh: 那些男的正在吃烧烤。

en: It is wrong to think that men are superior to women.
zh: 觉得男人比女人高人一等是不对的。

en: It is ridiculous as well as foolish to think man superior to woman, or woman to man.
zh: 觉得男的比女的强，或者女的比男的强，既愚蠢又可笑。

en: To think that men are superior to women or that women are superior to men is not just stupid, it's also ridiculous.
zh: 认为男人优于女人或者女人优于男人，不仅傻，而且荒唐。

en: It is wrong for a man to conceal things from his wife.
zh: 男人不该瞒着老婆做事。

en: It is true of American society that the male is the head of the household.
zh: 在美国社会，确实通常是男性当家。

en: A man is picking out a tune on the guitar.
zh: 有个男的正在吉他上拨拉着曲子。

en: Man is as fickle as autumn weather.
zh: 男人的心就像秋天的天气一样变幻莫测。

en: Jealousy in a relationship is often brought about by a lack of trust.
zh: 感情里的嫉妒通常是因为缺乏信任造成的。

en: No inequality should be allowed to exist between men and women.
zh: 男女之间不应该存在任何不平等。

en: Men and women must respect each other.
zh: 男女之间必须互相尊重。

en: Why are there differences between the male and the female?
zh: 为什么男女之间会有区别呢？

en: Both men and women won the tennis championship.
zh: 男女选手都拿到了网球冠军。

en: Each boy has received his diploma.
zh: 每个男孩都领到了毕业证。

en: The schoolboys marched four abreast.
zh: 男学生们四个一排齐步走。

en: Each boy student has a school badge on his cap.
zh: 每个男生的帽子上都有个校徽。

en: Both boys and girls should take cooking class in school.
zh: 男生和女生在学校都应该上烹饪课。

en: The schoolboys teased each other endlessly.
zh: 那些男生不停地互相打趣。

en: Boys tend to look down on their sisters.
zh: 男孩子往往容易瞧不起自己的姐妹。

en: You must behave yourself like a man.
zh: 你得表现得像个男子汉。

en: Act like a man.
zh: 爷们儿一点。

en: You must act like a man.
zh: 你得像个男人一样。

en: Men and women went into battle.
zh: 男女都上了战场。

en: The patient implored, "Please ... Break my arms!"
zh: 病人哀求道：“求你了……把我的胳膊打断吧！”

en: The man fought bravely but finally gave in.
zh: 那个男人战斗得很勇敢，但最后还是屈服了。

en: A man stood behind the gate gazing at the house.
zh: 一个男人站在大门口盯着房子看。

en: The man awed the girl with his magic tricks.
zh: 那个男的用魔术把小姑娘看呆了。

en: The man began to take off his hat, glasses and mask.
zh: 那个男的开始摘掉帽子、眼镜和口罩。

en: The man peeped through a hole in the wall.
zh: 那个男的从墙上的小洞往里偷看。

en: The man cheated her out of her money.
zh: 那个男的骗了她的钱。

en: The man robbed her of her handbag.
zh: 那个男的抢了她的手提包。

en: All the man could do was obey them.
zh: 那个男的除了听他们的也没别的办法。

en: The man seized him by the neck.
zh: 那个男的掐住了他的脖子。

en: The man suddenly struck me on the head.
zh: 那个男的突然打了一下我的头。

en: Man is judged by his courage, woman by her charm.
zh: 看男人看胆识，看女人看魅力。

en: The man was found dead in his bedroom in the morning.
zh: 那个男的早上被发现死在了卧室里。

en: The man threw a bag across his shoulder.
zh: 那个男的把包甩到了肩膀上。

en: Man will not cry in public.
zh: 男人不会在大庭广众之下哭。

en: The man pleaded for mercy, but he was sentenced to twenty years in prison for his crime.
zh: 那个男的求饶了，但他还是因为罪行被判了二十年。

en: The man terrified the little children.
zh: 那个男的把小孩子们吓坏了。

en: Man is the hunter, woman is his game.
zh: 男人是猎人，女人是猎物。

en: The man got mad when his wife called him names.
zh: 那男的老婆骂他的时候，他火了。

en: A man is never so on trial as in the moment of excessive good fortune.
zh: 一个人在走大运的时候，最能考验他的本性。

en: The man aimed a gun at the detectives.
zh: 那个人拿枪指着侦探。

en: The man got up and smoked.
zh: 那男的站起来抽了根烟。

en: The man is wearing a pair of glasses.
zh: 那个男人戴着一副眼镜。

en: The boy is wearing glasses.
zh: 那个小男孩戴着眼镜。

en: The man walked around the corner.
zh: 那个男的拐过了转角。

en: The guy jumped his bill at the restaurant.
zh: 那家伙在餐厅里吃霸王餐。

en: The man left the restaurant without paying his bill.
zh: 那男的没付钱就离开餐厅了。

en: The man left the restaurant without paying.
zh: 那男的没结账就走了。

en: The man lit a cigarette with a lighter.
zh: 那个男人用打火机点着了烟。

en: The man came to a dead stop.
zh: 那个男的突然停了下来。

en: The man looked at Tom, then vanished through the stage door out into the dark London street.
zh: 那人看了看汤姆，然后从舞台门溜了出去，消失在伦敦昏暗的街道里。

en: He stopped by Tom's chair.
zh: 他在汤姆的椅子旁边停了下来。

en: Men are but children of a larger growth.
zh: 男人不过是长大了的孩子。

en: The man cheated the old woman out of her money.
zh: 那男的骗了那个老太太的钱。

en: The man confessed that he had robbed the old woman.
zh: 那个男人交代了是他抢了那个老太太。

en: You can't expect a man to change his habits at once, girl.
zh: 姑娘，你别指望男人能一下子改掉习惯。

en: Men judged those women to be odd or dangerous.
zh: 男人们觉得那些女人要么古怪，要么危险。

en: The man was hiding in a dense forest.
zh: 那个男人躲在茂密的森林里。

en: The guy was too selfish to resist temptation.
zh: 那家伙太自私了，经不起诱惑。

en: A man is as old as he feels.
zh: 人的心态有多老，人就有多老。

en: A man is as old as he feels and a woman as old as she looks.
zh: 男人看心态，女人看长相。

en: A man is as old as he feels, and a woman as old as she looks.
zh: 男人看心态，女人看长相。

en: Some boys don't like to bathe regularly.
zh: 有些男孩子不喜欢经常洗澡。

en: If you want a man to propose marriage, feed him well.
zh: 要想让男人向你求婚，就得先把他喂饱。

en: The boys kept quiet.
zh: 男孩子们保持沉默。

en: I saw the man knocked down and the driver driving away.
zh: 我看见那个男的被撞倒了，司机却开车跑了。

en: Boys always want to play football after school.
zh: 男孩子放学后总想去踢球。

en: All the boys fell in love with Julia.
zh: 所有男孩都爱上了茱莉亚。

en: Each of the boys was eager to join in the race.
zh: 每个男孩都急着想参加比赛。

en: So the little boy put his hands in his pockets.
zh: 于是那个小男孩把手插进了口袋里。

en: Boys tend to look down on their younger sisters.
zh: 男孩子往往瞧不起他们的妹妹。

en: The boy pressed his face against the shop window.
zh: 那个男孩把脸贴在商店的橱窗上。

en: And the boy grew older.
zh: 后来，那个男孩渐渐长大了。

en: The boy begged for a new bicycle.
zh: 那个男孩央求要一辆新自行车。

en: The boy begged for a new bike.
zh: 那个男孩央求要一辆新单车。

en: The little boy counts it out on his fingers and said, "Seven."
zh: 小男孩掐着指头算了算，说：“七个。”

en: The boy stuffed cake into his mouth.
zh: 那个男孩往嘴里塞蛋糕。

en: I remembered that boys will be boys.
zh: 我记起男孩子终究还是爱淘气的。

en: Boys will be boys.
zh: 男孩子嘛，本性难移。

en: All boys like to play baseball.
zh: 男孩子都喜欢打棒球。

en: The boy's fingers moved in this pockets. Then he replied, "Eleven."
zh: 小男孩的手在口袋里动了动，然后回答说：“十一个。”

en: Boys will run risks.
zh: 男孩子总是喜欢冒险。

en: The boy gazed at the player dreamily.
zh: 那个男孩出神地盯着那个运动员。

en: Boys often imitate their sports heroes.
zh: 男孩子经常模仿他们崇拜的体育明星。

en: They are very popular among boys.
zh: 他们在男孩子当中很受欢迎。

en: A boy needs a father he can look up to.
zh: 男孩子需要一个能让他崇拜的父亲。

en: Boys can be trained to behave.
zh: 男孩子也是可以教乖的。

en: There is a great difference between boys and girls.
zh: 男生和女生差别挺大的。

en: Few boys are dainty about their food.
zh: 没几个男孩子对吃的很挑剔。

en: Is it a boy or a girl?
zh: 是男孩还是女孩？

en: Whether it's a son or a daughter, a child is someone you have to take care of until they get married. That's what I think.
zh: 不管是儿子还是女儿，孩子都得照顾到结婚，我是这么想的。

en: The boys were quiet.
zh: 那些男孩挺安静的。

en: Some boys made away with all the ripe fruits on my persimmon tree.
zh: 几个男孩把我那棵柿子树上熟了的果子全给摘走了。

en: A baby boy was born to them.
zh: 他们生了个男孩。

en: The boy threw a stone at the dog.
zh: 那个男孩拿石头砸那只狗。

en: There is nothing wrong with boys wearing cosmetics.
zh: 男孩子化点妆也没什么。

en: A boy is taking his sweet time pushing the cart toward the curb.
zh: 有个男孩磨磨蹭蹭地推着车往路边走。

en: I saw a boy swimming across the river.
zh: 我看到一个男孩正游过那条河。

en: A boy was giving out newspapers in the rain.
zh: 有个男孩在雨里发报纸。

en: Boys are fond of mischief.
zh: 男孩子都爱捣蛋。

en: Never love unless you can bear with all the faults of man.
zh: 除非你能受得了男人所有的缺点，否则千万别去爱。

en: It is up to us to be men.
zh: 咱们得像个男人样。

en: You must not compare a man with a woman.
zh: 别拿男人跟女人比。

en: I feel strongly that men and women are equal.
zh: 我觉得男女就是平等的。

en: It is advisable for a man or woman to acquire an accomplishment.
zh: 不管是男是女，学点本事总归是好的。

en: If you are a man, behave as such.
zh: 是个爷们儿就得有个爷们儿样。

en: The men went hunting for lions.
zh: 那些男的去猎狮子了。

en: The men loaded the baggage into the truck.
zh: 那些男的把行李搬上了卡车。

en: A man on horseback came along the path.
zh: 一个人骑着马顺着小道过来了。

en: A man can no more become a woman than a monkey can develop into a man.
zh: 男人变不成女人，就像猴子变不成男人一样。

en: A man shouted something, waving his hand.
zh: 有个男人一边挥手一边喊着什么。

en: A man came up and spoke to me.
zh: 有个男人走过来跟我说话。

en: To my horror, the man took a gun out of his pocket.
zh: 吓死我了，那男的从口袋里掏出一把枪。

en: I saw a man enter the room.
zh: 我看见一个男人进了房间。

en: I saw a man standing naked under the waterfall.
zh: 我看见个男的光着身子站在瀑布下面。

en: It's getting darker little by little.
zh: 天一点点黑了。

en: Do you have a table in front of the fireplace?
zh: 壁炉前面有桌子吗？

en: Shift the sofa so that it faces the fireplace.
zh: 把沙发挪一下，正对着壁炉。

en: The clock is above the fireplace.
zh: 钟在壁炉上方。

en: Clean the ashes out of the fireplace.
zh: 把壁炉里的灰清理一下。

en: The fireplace lends coziness to this room.
zh: 有了壁炉，这屋子感觉温馨多了。

en: The fireplace was burning brightly.
zh: 壁炉里的火烧得很旺。

en: A warm current runs off the coast of Shikoku.
zh: 四国岛沿岸有一股暖流。

en: Did you turn off the heater?
zh: 你关暖气了吗？

en: The heater is broken.
zh: 暖气坏了。

en: The heating doesn't work.
zh: 暖气没法用。

en: Run the engine till it gets warm.
zh: 让发动机转一会儿热热身。

en: Ice turns to water when it gets warm.
zh: 冰一暖和就化成水了。

en: I think it's getting warmer.
zh: 我觉得天变暖和了。

en: As it got warmer, I took off the sweater.
zh: 天暖和了，我就把毛衣脱了。

en: I took off my sweater because it got warmer.
zh: 因为暖和了，我就把毛衣脱了。

en: Since it got warmer, I took off my sweater.
zh: 既然暖和了，我就把毛衣脱了。

en: Warm and humid weather increases the number of crimes.
zh: 天气又热又潮，犯罪率都变高了。

en: A warm, sunny day is ideal for a picnic.
zh: 这种暖和的晴天最适合野餐了。

en: Dress yourself warmly before you go out.
zh: 出门前穿暖和点。

en: You should keep yourself warm.
zh: 你得注意保暖。

en: He took the coat off because it was warm.
zh: 因为暖和，他就把外套脱了。

en: We can buy hot lunches.
zh: 我们可以买热乎的午餐。

en: Wear warm clothes.
zh: 穿暖和点儿。

en: On warm days, bears stretch out or lie on their backs with their feet in the air.
zh: 天气暖和的时候，熊会摊开身子，或者四脚朝天地躺着。

en: It was a warm day.
zh: 那天挺暖和的。

en: After a succession of warm days, the weather became cold.
zh: 连着暖和了好几天，天又变冷了。

en: After continuing days of warm weather, it became cold.
zh: 暖和了几天后，天变冷了。

en: After days of warm weather, it became cold.
zh: 暖和了几天，天就冷了。

en: I don't like warm winters.
zh: 我不喜欢暖冬。

en: During warm weather, sweating helps man regulate his body temperature.
zh: 天热的时候，出汗能帮人调节体温。

en: Warm human relations were fostered.
zh: 大家都相处得很融洽。

en: Greet him with a warm smile.
zh: 笑着跟他打个招呼。

en: I was pleased no end by the cordial welcome.
zh: 受到那么热情的欢迎，我特别高兴。

en: The last agony was over.
zh: 最后的痛苦终于结束了。

en: The disadvantage of excellent insulation is that it quickly leads to overheating.
zh: 隔热效果太好的缺点是，很快就会变得太热。

en: The water supply has failed.
zh: 停水了。

en: The water has been cut off.
zh: 停水了。

en: An old castle stands on top of the cliff.
zh: 悬崖上有一座古堡。

en: If we decline, what are the alternatives?
zh: 要是我们拒绝，还有什么别的选择吗？

en: I will never change my mind.
zh: 我绝不会改变主意的。

en: The bullet penetrated him.
zh: 子弹击穿了他。

en: The bullet went right through his head.
zh: 子弹直接贯穿了他的头部。

en: The bullet penetrated his muscular chest.
zh: 子弹击穿了他强壮的胸膛。

en: The bullet penetrated his chest.
zh: 子弹打穿了他的胸部。

en: The bullet glanced off the target.
zh: 子弹擦过目标飞走了。

en: The bullet penetrated the partition.
zh: 子弹打穿了隔板。

en: The bullet got the policeman in the leg.
zh: 子弹打中了警察的腿。

en: The bullet entered above the knee.
zh: 子弹打在膝盖上方。

en: We marched under a hail of bullets.
zh: 我们顶着枪林弹雨前进。

en: The oppressed people cried out for their liberty.
zh: 受压迫的人民呐喊着追求自由。

en: The bullet just shaved his cheek.
zh: 子弹擦着他的脸颊飞过去。

en: The bullet found its mark.
zh: 子弹击中了目标。

en: A bullet pierced the helmet.
zh: 一颗子弹打穿了头盔。

en: It's more interesting to travel alone than to go on a group tour.
zh: 一个人去旅游比报团有意思。

en: Organized sports are often an important part of school life, and competitive sports are popular, too.
zh: 团体运动是学校生活的重要部分，竞技运动也很受欢迎。

en: Strength in unity.
zh: 团结就是力量。

en: United, we are equal to most anything.
zh: 团结一致，我们就无所不能。

en: Please don't say your birthday is over.
zh: 别说你的生日已经过完了。

en: How did you celebrate your birthday?
zh: 你是怎么过生日的？

en: How was your birthday?
zh: 你生日过得怎么样？

en: When's your birthday?
zh: 你生日是什么时候？

en: It is kind of you to give me a birthday present.
zh: 谢谢你送我生日礼物。

en: I will give you this bicycle as a birthday present.
zh: 我要把这辆自行车当作生日礼物送给你。

en: It's very kind of you to invite me to your birthday party.
zh: 谢谢你邀请我参加你的生日聚会。

en: Thank you for inviting me to your birthday party.
zh: 谢谢你邀请我参加你的生日派对。

en: You shall have a new bicycle for your birthday.
zh: 你过生日时会有一辆新自行车的。

en: I will give you a new bicycle for your birthday.
zh: 我会送你一辆新自行车当生日礼物。

en: You'll get a lot of presents on your birthday.
zh: 你生日那天会收到很多礼物。

en: You shall have a new watch for your birthday.
zh: 你过生日会有一块新手表的。

en: I look forward to my birthday.
zh: 我很期待我的生日。

en: The birthday is the day on which a person was born.
zh: 生日就是一个人出生的那天。

en: Many happy returns of the day!
zh: 祝你年年有今日，岁岁有今朝。

en: Happy birthday!
zh: 生日快乐！

en: Have a birthday drink! It's on the house.
zh: 喝杯生日酒吧，这杯算店里的。

en: There were more people present at the birthday party than was expected.
zh: 生日聚会来的人比预想的要多。

en: Birth is, in a manner, the beginning of death.
zh: 从某种意义上说，出生就是死亡的开始。

en: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
zh: 生死无法避免，唯有享受当下的时光。

en: For gall bladder surgery, go down this hall and take a right.
zh: 做胆囊手术请沿着走廊走到底然后右转。

en: To make a long story short, he was fired.
zh: 长话短说，他被炒了。

en: To put it briefly, he lacks musical ability.
zh: 简单来说，他没啥音乐天赋。

en: In short, I don't want you to work for that company.
zh: 总之，我不希望你去那家公司上班。

en: It was not easy to get a lot of money in a short time.
zh: 想在短时间内赚大钱可不容易。

en: Armed only with a short sword, he drove off all five of his attackers.
zh: 他仅凭一把短剑，就打跑了那五个袭击者。

en: Haste is waste.
zh: 欲速则不达。

en: Apart from her temper, she's all right.
zh: 除了脾气有点怪，她人还挺好的。

en: The short term contract employees were dismissed without notice.
zh: 那些短期合同工没接到通知就被解雇了。

en: You can not master English in a short time.
zh: 英语不是短时间内就能掌握的。

en: I must have it shortened.
zh: 我得把它改短点。

en: Be sure to drop me a line.
zh: 记得给我发个消息。

en: The differing volumes of carbon emissions are plotted in the graph below.
zh: 下图标出了不同的碳排放量。

en: I heard the news that there had been a big earthquake in Awaji.
zh: 我听说淡路岛发生了大地震。

en: Hold onto your husband.
zh: 管好你老公。

en: Her husband also wanted custody of the children.
zh: 她丈夫也想要孩子的抚养权。

en: Detective stories are amusing.
zh: 侦探小说挺有意思的。

en: The detective took six months to get at the truth of that affair.
zh: 那个侦探花了半年时间才查清那件事的真相。

en: The expedition has postponed its departure to the Antarctic.
zh: 考察队推迟了出发去南极的时间。

en: The expedition passed through the great jungle.
zh: 探险队穿过了那片大丛林。

en: The expedition's supplies soon gave out.
zh: 考察队的补给很快就用完了。

en: The explorers discovered a skeleton in the cave.
zh: 探险家在洞穴里发现了一具骸骨。

en: The explorer bartered with the natives for food.
zh: 探险家用东西跟当地人换了食物。

en: Seek, and you will find.
zh: 寻找，就能找到。

en: Could you help me to find it?
zh: 你能帮我找找吗？

en: Please look for it.
zh: 请找一下。

en: Did you find what you were looking for?
zh: 找到你在找的东西了吗？

en: I found a rare book I had been looking for.
zh: 我找到了一本找了很久的稀有书。

en: Mr. Tanaka, our homeroom teacher, got married.
zh: 咱们班主任田中老师结婚了。

en: My homeroom teacher is the same age as my mother.
zh: 我班主任跟我妈同岁。

en: Homeroom teachers should make every effort to keep in touch with their students.
zh: 班主任应该尽力跟学生保持联系。

en: I'll transfer you to the right person.
zh: 我帮你转接给负责的人。

en: Who is the person in charge?
zh: 谁是负责人？

en: It took courage to sail across the Pacific single-handed.
zh: 独自驾船横穿太平洋需要很大的勇气。

en: Climbing the cliff alone is a bold deed.
zh: 一个人去爬悬崖真是够大胆的。

en: The meaning of a word is determined by the context where it is used.
zh: 词义是由它所在的语境决定的。

en: If you don't know the meaning of a word, look it up in a dictionary.
zh: 如果你不懂某个词的意思，就查查字典。

en: Can you please send ten $15 flashlights immediately?
zh: 能请你马上发十个15美元的手电筒过来吗？

en: Did you finish your class registration?
zh: 你选完课了吗？

en: I might flunk the course.
zh: 我这门课可能会挂。

en: If you buddy up to everybody and anybody, pretty soon people will think you're just a people-pleaser.
zh: 如果你跟谁都套近乎，很快大家就会觉得你是个讨好型人格。

en: Nobody would listen to me.
zh: 没人愿意听我说话。

en: No one respected men like him.
zh: 没人会尊敬他那样的人。

en: Not a single person arrived late.
zh: 没有一个人迟到。

en: None of them would admit to being the culprit.
zh: 他们谁都不肯承认自己是凶手。

en: Not a soul was to be seen in the town.
zh: 镇上连个人影儿都看不见。

en: The argument lasted a long time because nobody would admit to being in the wrong.
zh: 争论持续了很久，因为谁都不肯认错。

en: I had an argument with my sister about whom to invite.
zh: 我和我姐为了该请谁而吵了一架。

en: After I pick some blueberries, I make a tart.
zh: 我采完蓝莓后，要做个挞。

en: He forgot to lock the door.
zh: 他忘了锁门。

en: No one has failed.
zh: 谁都没失败。

en: Who are you laughing at?
zh: 你在笑话谁呢？

en: No one will vote for the budget.
zh: 谁也不会给这笔预算投赞成票。

en: Nobody cares for me.
zh: 没人在乎我。

en: Nobody can put anything over on the bureau chief.
zh: 谁也蒙不了局长。

en: Nobody was allowed to go out of the room.
zh: 谁也不许出这个房间。

en: Don't let anyone enter the room.
zh: 别让任何人进屋。

en: Nobody noticed her absence.
zh: 没人注意到她不在。

en: Do you wonder why no one trusts him?
zh: 你不奇怪为什么没人信任他吗？

en: Nobody came to help him.
zh: 没人来帮过他。

en: Nobody could refuse their invitation.
zh: 谁都没法拒绝他们的邀请。

en: No one will trust his story.
zh: 没人会相信他编的故事。

en: No one believed his story.
zh: 没人相信他讲的那套话。

en: No one knows his name.
zh: 没人知道他叫什么。

en: No one could account for his poor examination results.
zh: 谁也没法解释他考试成绩为什么这么差。

en: Nobody seems to have paid attention to what he said.
zh: 好像谁都没注意他在说什么。

en: It seems that nobody takes any notice of his opinions.
zh: 看来没人把他的意见当回事。

en: No one took notice of him.
zh: 没人理他。

en: No one gave him a good chance.
zh: 谁也没给他个好机会。

en: Nobody can surpass him.
zh: 没人能超得过他。

en: Though it was the original, Amsterdam, and York, were beaten by New York.
zh: 虽然阿姆斯特丹和约克才是原型，但还是输给了纽约。

en: Nobody bowed to him.
zh: 没人向他鞠躬。

en: I have a cough and a little fever.
zh: 我咳嗽，还有点发烧。

en: Nobody doubts his fitness for the position.
zh: 没人怀疑他能不能胜任这个职位。

en: Nobody answered the telephone.
zh: 电话没人接。

en: No one has ever gone into heaven except the one who came from heaven – the Son of man.
zh: 除了从天降下的人子，没有谁升过天。

en: It's not something anyone would be ashamed of.
zh: 这事儿谁都不会觉得丢脸。

en: Everybody tends to be lazy.
zh: 大家都容易犯懒。

en: No one loves war.
zh: 没人喜欢打仗。

en: None of them is alive.
zh: 他们没一个活着的。

en: No person can decide when someone should die.
zh: 谁也不能决定别人的生死。

en: Everyone was friendly to the new girl.
zh: 大家对那个新来的女孩都很友好。

en: Nobody can exist without food.
zh: 人不吃东西就活不下去。

en: Everyone is afraid of doing new things.
zh: 谁都害怕尝试新鲜事物。

en: No one is coming.
zh: 没人要来。

en: No one was present.
zh: 当时谁都不在场。

en: No one really knows what a UFO is like.
zh: 谁也不知道UFO到底长什么样。

en: No one replied to the question.
zh: 没人回答那个问题。

en: Nobody having any question, he ended the lecture.
zh: 既然大家都没问题了，他就结束了讲座。

en: No one should force his views on others.
zh: 谁也不该把自己的观点强加给别人。

en: Nobody could believe what he saw.
zh: 谁也无法相信自己看到的。

en: Nobody could remember the sequence of events.
zh: 谁也记不清事情的先后顺序了。

en: No one can be a poet.
zh: 谁也成不了诗人。

en: Nobody can control us.
zh: 谁也管不了我们。

en: It goes without saying that nobody can come between us.
zh: 咱们俩的关系肯定谁也拆不散。

en: Nobody came to help me.
zh: 没人来帮我。

en: Nobody came to my rescue.
zh: 没人来救我。

en: No one helped me.
zh: 谁也没帮我。

en: Nobody bore me out.
zh: 没人能证明我说的是真的。

en: Nobody backed up what I said.
zh: 没人支持我的说法。

en: Nobody listened to me.
zh: 没人在听我说话。

en: Nobody answered my question.
zh: 没人回答我的问题。

en: Nobody perceived me entering the room.
zh: 谁也没发现我进屋了。

en: None can get away from death.
zh: 谁也逃不过一死。

en: Nobody answered the door.
zh: 没人开门。

en: Nobody can ever help me.
zh: 谁也帮不了我。

en: No one is free from faults.
zh: 谁都会犯错。

en: Nobody taught me.
zh: 没人教过我。

en: No one is to leave without permission.
zh: 没允许谁也不准离开。

en: Nobody was able to suggest a solution.
zh: 谁也没能提出个解决办法。

en: Nobody will regard us as office workers.
zh: 没人会把我们当成上班族。

en: He resented everyone's being very quiet.
zh: 大家都闷着不说话，让他很不爽。

en: No one excels him in English.
zh: 谁的英语也比不过他。

en: No one will bother to do such a thing.
zh: 没人会费劲去做这种事。

en: Now they're frightened of leaving it.
zh: 现在他们都不敢离开那儿了。

en: Every man has his weak points.
zh: 每个人都有弱点。

en: Nobody came to the party.
zh: 谁也没来参加聚会。

en: Heaven knows why.
zh: 天知道为什么。

en: No one can say that.
zh: 谁也不能那么说。

en: Nobody having any more to say, the meeting was closed.
zh: 既然没人再想说什么，会议就结束了。

en: Nobody had anything more to say.
zh: 谁也没话说了。

en: No one had anything left to say.
zh: 大家都没什么想说的了。

en: Nobody can understand it.
zh: 谁也理解不了。

en: No one knows how it came to pass.
zh: 谁也不知道事情是怎么发生的。

en: Nobody envied the old man, who was a millionaire.
zh: 没人羡慕那个当了百万富翁的老头。

en: No one could solve the problem.
zh: 谁也没法解决这个问题。

en: No one knew how to answer the question.
zh: 谁也不知道该怎么回答这个问题。

en: No one could find the answer.
zh: 谁也找不到答案。

en: No one can move the big box.
zh: 谁也搬不动那个大箱子。

en: No one caught on to the joke.
zh: 谁也没听懂那个笑话。

en: No one knows the fact.
zh: 谁也不知道真相。

en: None of us thought he was to blame for the accident.
zh: 我们谁也不觉得这次事故该怪他。

en: Nobody is to blame for the accident.
zh: 这场事故不怪任何人。

en: None have finished the work.
zh: 谁也没做完这活儿。

en: Nobody failed in the tactics.
zh: 谁也没在战术上出差错。

en: Nobody knows about the plan.
zh: 谁也不知道这个计划。

en: Nobody noticed that the picture was hung upside down.
zh: 没人注意到画挂倒了。

en: No one was present at the meeting.
zh: 谁也没去开会。

en: No one was in a hurry to leave the party.
zh: 谁也不急着离开聚会。

en: No one could solve the puzzle.
zh: 谁也没解开这个谜题。

en: No one called my attention to it.
zh: 没人提醒我注意这个。

en: No one can go in there.
zh: 谁也不准进那儿。

en: No one thinks so.
zh: 没人这么想。

en: Nobody ever comes to see us in this out-of-the-way village.
zh: 在这个偏僻的小村庄里，压根没人来看我们。

en: Nobody has solved the problem.
zh: 还没人解决这个问题。

en: Nobody can solve this problem.
zh: 谁也解决不了这个问题。

en: Don't let anyone enter or approach this room.
zh: 别让任何人进这个房间，也别让他们靠近。

en: I didn't think anyone could fix this watch.
zh: 我本以为没人能修好这块表。

en: No one can operate this machine.
zh: 没人会弄这台机器。

en: It is desirable that nobody should be hurt.
zh: 最好谁都别受伤。

en: Everybody plays the game of love.
zh: 谁都逃不过爱情。

en: We could all see it coming, couldn't we?
zh: 我们大家都预见到了，不是吗？

en: Everyone estimates her work highly.
zh: 大家都对她的工作评价很高。

en: Everybody speaks well of her.
zh: 大家都说她好话。

en: Everyone speaks well of him.
zh: 大家都说他好话。

en: Everybody had looked on him as a good-for-nothing.
zh: 大家都曾觉得他是个废物。

en: Everybody looked up to him.
zh: 大家都挺敬重他的。

en: Everybody regards him as honest.
zh: 大家都觉得他挺老实的。

en: Everyone considers him to be honest.
zh: 大家都认为他很诚实。

en: Everybody loves him.
zh: 大家都喜欢他。

en: Everyone loves him.
zh: 大家都挺爱他的。

en: Everybody knows that he is the last man to break his promise.
zh: 大家都知道他最守信用了。

en: Everyone recognized him as a brilliant pianist.
zh: 大家都公认他是位杰出的钢琴家。

en: Everybody admired his courage.
zh: 大家都佩服他的勇气。

en: Everyone admired his courage.
zh: 大家都很敬佩他的勇气。

en: Everybody knows his name.
zh: 大家都知道他的名字。

en: Everyone recognized his skill.
zh: 大家都认可他的技术。

en: Everyone opposed it, but Sally and Bob got married all the same.
zh: 大家都反对，但萨莉和鲍勃还是结婚了。

en: Everyone strives for efficiency but few seem to attain it.
zh: 大家都追求效率，但没几个人能真正做到。

en: Not everyone is properly rewarded for his efforts.
zh: 努力不一定都能得到应有的回报。

en: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
zh: 谁都想活得长，但谁也不想变老。

en: Everyone admitted that the earth is a sphere.
zh: 大家都承认地球是球形的。

en: Everybody knows that he likes her and vice versa.
zh: 大家都知道他喜欢她，她也喜欢他。

en: We are all longing for peace in the world.
zh: 我们大家都渴望世界和平。

en: Everyone has a right to enjoy his liberty.
zh: 每个人都有享受自由的权利。

en: Everyone mistakes me for my brother.
zh: 大家都把我当成我哥了。

en: Everybody says I look like my father.
zh: 大家都说我长得像我爸。

en: Everyone said that I was wrong.
zh: 大家都说是我错了。

en: Nobody can escape death.
zh: 谁都难逃一死。

en: Everyone loves to hear praise, but over-praise has the opposite effect of sounding insincere.
zh: 谁都爱听好话，但夸得过头了反而显得假。

en: Everyone seeks happiness.
zh: 每个人都在追求幸福。

en: Everybody shouted for joy.
zh: 大家都高兴得欢呼起来。

en: Everybody wants permanent peace.
zh: 大家都想要永久的和平。

en: To my amusement, everyone believed my story.
zh: 好笑的是，大家都信了我的话。

en: It is not given to everybody to study abroad.
zh: 不是谁都有机会出国留学的。

en: Everyone's saying it.
zh: 大家都这么说。

en: Everyone knows the law.
zh: 大家都懂法。

en: Easy money is on Mulligan.
zh: 大家觉得赌穆利根赢稳赚。

en: Everyone recognizes the boy as a real genius.
zh: 大家都公认那孩子是个天才。

en: It was natural that everyone should like the girl.
zh: 大家都喜欢那个女孩，那是理所当然的。

en: Everybody expected that the experiment would result in failure.
zh: 大家都预料到实验会失败。

en: Everyone will accept that idea in principle.
zh: 大家都原则上接受那个想法。

en: Everyone knew the song.
zh: 大家都听过这首歌。

en: Everyone says the view from here is beautiful.
zh: 大家都说从这儿看的景色很美。

en: Everyone always speaks well of Tom.
zh: 大家总是夸汤姆。

en: The little girl will go astray if no one cares much about her.
zh: 如果没人管这个小女孩，她会变坏的。

en: Nobody can stop me!
zh: 谁也拦不住我！

en: Anybody is better than nobody.
zh: 有人总比没人强。

en: But she gets it while she can.
zh: 但她能拿的时候绝不放过。

en: Nobody speaks well of that politician.
zh: 没人说那个政客的好话。

en: It is because of his selfishness that no one wants to associate with him.
zh: 就因为他太自私，才没人愿意跟他来往。

en: No one will speak for you.
zh: 没人会替你说话。

en: It's pity that nobody came to meet you at the station.
zh: 真可惜，都没人去车站接你。

en: No one can deprive of your human rights.
zh: 谁也不能剥夺你的人权。

en: Nobody can live by himself.
zh: 谁也没法一个人活。

en: No one knows what will happen in the 1990's.
zh: 谁也不知道九十年代会发生什么。

en: No one can keep me from going there.
zh: 谁也拦不住我去那儿。

en: I'm going there. No one can stop me.
zh: 我要去那儿，谁也别想拦我。

en: Everyone remembers the happy days of youth as his halcyon days.
zh: 每个人都觉得年轻时的快乐时光是最好的日子。

en: Not anybody likes this book.
zh: 谁都不喜欢这本书。

en: No one's frightened of playing it.
zh: 谁也不怕玩这个。

en: By all accounts, he is not a man to be trusted.
zh: 大家都说他这人不靠谱。

en: Tell me whose advice to follow.
zh: 告诉我该听谁的。

en: No one to blame but yourself.
zh: 谁也不怪，就怪你自己。

en: A vein of poetry exists in the hearts of all men.
zh: 每个人的内心深处都有一点诗意。

en: It is important to avoid having anyone absent from his assignment.
zh: 重要的是不能让任何人在分配的任务上缺勤。

en: It is important that no one is allowed to slack off on their assigned work.
zh: 关键是不能让任何人在分配的工作上偷懒。

en: Nobody can dispense with somebody's service.
zh: 谁都离不开别人的帮忙。

en: Whose bicycle did you want to borrow?
zh: 你想借谁的自行车？

en: Who is it that you're working for?
zh: 你在给谁干活？

en: It's nobody's fault but yours. I'm determined to make you take the responsibility.
zh: 这谁也不怪就怪你，我一定要让你负责。

en: Who are you referring to?
zh: 你指的是谁？

en: Who were you talking to?
zh: 你刚才在跟谁说话？

en: I don't know who to turn to.
zh: 我不知道该找谁帮忙。

en: Who shall I choose?
zh: 我该选谁呢？

en: Whom should I inform?
zh: 我该通知谁？

en: Who should I inform?
zh: 我该告诉谁？

en: Who are they for?
zh: 这些是给谁的？

en: It makes no difference who I meet.
zh: 见谁都一样。

en: Who was radium discovered by?
zh: 镭是谁发现的？

en: It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
zh: 再坏的事也会有人得利。

en: I try not to bother anyone.
zh: 我尽量不麻烦别人。

en: He walked on tiptoe so that nobody would hear him.
zh: 他踮着脚走，怕被人听见。

en: No one can tell.
zh: 谁也说不准。

en: No one knows.
zh: 谁也不知道。

en: Don't give the secret away to anyone.
zh: 别把这秘密告诉任何人。

en: Everyone has his intellectual desire; mine is to escape life as I know it.
zh: 每个人都有精神追求，我的追求就是逃避现实生活。

en: Everyone has his intellectual desire.
zh: 每个人都有自己的精神追求。

en: Every person has a right to defend themselves.
zh: 每个人都有自卫的权利。

en: Give this ticket to whoever comes first.
zh: 谁先来就把这票给谁。

en: This is strictly between us.
zh: 这事儿就咱俩知道，别传出去。

en: I didn't meet anyone.
zh: 我谁也没碰见。

en: Every dogs has his own day.
zh: 每个人都有走运的时候。

en: I could not get anybody to go with me, and so I went by myself.
zh: 我找不着人陪我，就自己去了。
